data.title: Fun time for the younguns
data.text: A fun educational experience for younger children. Through hands-on opportunities, kids learn the importance of healthy habits and what they can do to achieve them.

data.title: CLOSED AS OF JULY 2013
data.text: see website closing after 40 something years.CLOSed closed closedCLOSed closed closedCLOSed closed closedCLOSed closed closed

data.title: For kids!
data.text:
Somehow I missed that this is really for kids only. In fast, they will not allow entry to adults without children. The Health Adventure website doesn't really give that vibe; it seems to give more of the vibe that this is great educational fun for everyone.
We (childless couple) were stuck in Asheville on a rainy day looking for something to do. Had to keep looking.

data.title: Rainy day activity
data.text: Good for kids between 2 and 7 years old. Could maybe spend 3 hours there. We liked the Smokey the Bear exhibit.

data.title: same ol
data.text: they need to upgrade. the staff is rude! I took my 2 kids there and wasn't happy its the same things that were there when I was a child

data.title: Enjoyable museum experience
data.text: It has been awhile since I visited here,but I remember thoroughly enjoying the hand-on exhibits and all the education regarding the body. School children often visit here.  Well worth the time of a tourist family.

data.title: Fun afternoon
data.text: We visited the Health Adventure to supplement a school study of the human body.  The staff there was very helpful and we loved the fact that the museum is connected to the mall - we grabbed a quick lunch at Chic Fil A and then returned to the museum for further play time.  Our children are 9 and 11, and I would say they were at the upper end of the ages of enjoyment for this museum.  We spent about 2-1/2 hours there.

data.title: Fun and educational experience
data.text: This museum is fun for the entire family, and the location is so convenient.  The exhibits seems to change frequently, as every time we have visited there is something new.  Highly recommend, especially if you have young kids.

data.title: Safe & educational
data.text: We just received our membership in July & love it! Our three year old asks to come once a week. The exhibits are always changing & keeps learning fun.

data.title: Young kids love it
data.text: My great niece and nephew, ages 3 & 6,  just love this place... and they even seem to learn some things.

data.title: Overpriced
data.text: It is interesting enough once but it's not something that I would pay for a membership.

data.title: Check out the space exhibit!
data.text: My 3 year old had a ton of fun at the Health Adventure, and they have a new space exhibit that's amazing! Can't beat a location where you can get a little shopping done at the same time too.

data.title: Well thought out experience for kids
data.text: Changing exhibits and a good place to host a birthday party.

data.title: Fun for whole family
data.text: No one wants to be told about good habits on a trip but they do it in a fun none preachy way.  Lots of science also.  Great interactive for kids.  Lots of space.  You will be happy you stopped for a break or on a rainy day.

data.title: Nice educational venture
data.text: Very nice for children 8 and under.  People friendly and helpful.

data.title: Good combination of fun and education!!!
data.text:
I had no idea Park Ridge Hospitals had taken over the Health Adventure.  It was such a great experience.  The staff was so friendly, the entire place was very clean, and there was as much fun as educational stuff to do.  My kids had so much fun, and I had a blast spending the day with them at the Health Adventure.  

Side note-they don't have food for sale, but there is a food court in the mall, and there is a great snack area inside the Health Adventure.

data.title: Great place for my kids
data.text: I have two small boys and they love to go to the health adventure.  We have taken them to other places in the area like Fun Depot, but I would prefer to take them to the Health Adventure because I feel like they are doing things that are more educational.  also, being a member is smart, because you have paid for as many visits as you want.  I recommend it to people in the Asheville area.  2 trips to the Fun Depot and you've paid for a year at the health adventure.  love the new location too - no parking issues!

data.title: Soo much better in the new location!
data.text: The new location is so much easier. I like the fact that you can park right there now! it is a lot more convenient. The one thing I dreaded the most about the old location was walking so far from the parking deck with three small children. My kids had a blast (as so did we) learning and seeing all that was available. The staff was fun and Knoweladgeble.  I highly recommended going and seeing this new location with your family.

data.title: Perfect place to let kids explore and learn!
data.text: Free parking makes all the difference.  2x size of old place.  Over 50 stations for kids to explore.  My 2 year old loves the new creative play space.  Membership is for a year and pays for itself after just 3 visits.  Other places charge every time and don't offer the variety.  Enjoying watching my 3 kids explore!

data.title: Great Location, Easy Access, Wonderful People!
data.text: I took my daughter to the Health Adventure thinking that maybe she would be too old for it at 8.  I was wrong!  She and three friends had a blast for the day climbing and playing on the exhibits, snowboarding, learning about the body and recording puppet shows on video.  While we were there, we saw a class of elderly folks doing lite exercise.  There's a little something for everyone at The Health Adventure!  Great new location means you don't have to take your kids downtown where they might see anything.  Parking is now free and you walk right inside.  We loved it so much we bought a membership!
